Description: Shoulder sherd of East Greek (South Ionian?) pottery closed vessel (oinochoe?); light orange-brown clay with some silver mica; interior: reserved; exterior: lower wall black bordered by thin red painted line; upper wall reserved; votive inscription cut to Hera on upper wall.
Curator's comments: There is on the inside a modern graffiti identifying it as being from the area of the temenos of Hera.
Bibliographic references: Gardner 1888 / Naukratis II (p. 67, no. 846, pl. XXII, no. 846)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 692, no. 495)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.651)
